messages.content: When making my maiden speech to Parliament in 1997, I described the Morecambe & Lunesdale constituency as an area of outstanding natural beauty and the Gateway to the Lakes.

I am reasonably pleased with the progress that has been made so far but there is still much more to do. It is therefore absolutely essential that further substantial investment in our infrastructure and public services is made as soon as the economic recovery has been firmly secured.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: After years of sustained economic growth and extensive investment of public funds, substantial improvements have been made to the area's infrastructure and many of the social ills have been addressed.
Funding for extra doctors, nurses and equipment have led to vastly reduced waiting times, improved patient care and clinical outcomes at the Royal Lancaster Infirmary.
Additional funding has provided for extra police and community support officers. As a result, burglary and vehicle crime in the area are at an all-time low and anti-social behavior is reduced.

Refurbishment of housing stock in Poulton, the West End of Morecambe and Ryelands has uplifted those areas. Local projects like The Midland Hotel, Carnforth Railway Station, Tern and Sea Defence projects have been spectacular successes, providing many jobs for local people.
The extra investment going into our schools has enabled more teachers and classroom assistants to be employed and played its part in improving standards being achieved by local children.

mentions.candidate: Ensured access to constituencies, sought to give of best on their behalf, seeking re-election, maiden speech to Parliament in 1997.

issues.education: The extra investment going into our schools has enabled more teachers and classroom assistants to be employed and played its part in improving standards being achieved by local children.
issues.health: Funding for extra doctors, nurses and equipment have led to vastly reduced waiting times, improved patient care and clinical outcomes at the Royal Lancaster Infirmary.

housing.content: Refurbishment of much of the housing stock in Poulton, the West End of Morecambe and Ryelands.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am reasonably pleased with the progress that has been made so far but there is still much more to do. It is therefore absolutely essential that further substantial investment in our infrastructure and public services is made as soon as the economic recovery has been firmly secured.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for this constituency
politicalExperience.achievements: Ensured that I am readily accessible to my constituents and have always sought to give of my best on their behalf.

contactInformation.address: Labour Party Office, 26/28 Victoria Street, Morecambe, Lancs LA4 4AJ
